commonMistakes.title: Not providing descriptive title and description
commonMistakes.description: Messages should have clear, actionable text
commonMistakes.correct: <InOnPageMessage type="error" title-text="Error occurred" description-text="Please check your input and try again" />
commonMistakes.impact: Empty or unclear error messages confuse users

commonMistakes.title: Not using appropriate message types
commonMistakes.description: Type should match message severity for accessibility
commonMistakes.impact: Screen readers and visual indicators won't match message severity

bestPractices.title: Use Clear, Actionable Messages
bestPractices.description: Messages should tell users what happened and what to do next
bestPractices.code:
<InOnPageMessage
  type="error"
  title-text="Upload failed"
  description-text="File size exceeds 5MB. Please compress and try again."
  link-button-status
  link-button-text="Learn more"
  @link-click="openHelp"
/>
bestPractices.benefit: Users understand the problem and know how to fix it

bestPractices.title: Match Message Type to Severity
bestPractices.description: Use appropriate type for each situation

exampleEnrichments.title: Error Message with Action
exampleEnrichments.code:
<script setup>
import { InOnPageMessage } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const openSupport = () => {
  window.open('https://support.example.com', '_blank');
};
</script>

<template>
  <InOnPageMessage
    type="error"
    size="medium"
    title-status
    title-text="Connection failed"
    description-text="Unable to connect to server. Please check your internet connection."
    link-button-status
    link-button-text="Contact Support"
    @link-click="openSupport"
  />
</template>

exampleEnrichments.title: Success Message
exampleEnrichments.code:
<InOnPageMessage
  type="success"
  size="medium"
  title-status
  title-text="Changes saved"
  description-text="Your profile has been updated successfully."
/>
